ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned to read and write comfortably in Vietnamese as well as create deep connections with my classmates
I learned basic conversational Vietnamese in this course, including tones, grammar, and syntax. I also learned a few general points about the culture.
I gained basic conversation, reading, and writing skills. I also learned some cultural and historical facts.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: strong Vietnamese community established and great immersive learning, very flexible

Weaknesses: a little unorganized, some deviations from the agenda

I thought that the pacing of content was just right. You get to speak to the professor and to each other a lot during class, forming a sense of community while you hone your speaking and listening skills. No project or presentation has ever felt overly stressful beyond the usual nerves that come with public speaking. Deadlines for assignments can be unclear, despite the schedule the professor sends out every week. Sometimes you may have to hustle to get a presentation done, or you'll work on a presentation you'll never give. However, the professor is extremely flexible, lenient, and understanding. Sometimes, it can also be unclear what assignments actually contribute to your grade, so you might find yourself doing some busy work. Still, the class was overall very very fun and enjoyable.
Thay Quang is a great instructor. I appreciate his lectures and packet. Sometimes certain lessons would be sped through.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: YES! This course will provide you a solid understanding in the language and make you want to learn more. Take it!
